key_changes.change: Core extensions (e.g., SSE, WebSocket) are moved out of the core repository into their own packages.
key_changes.impact: If you were using hx-sse or hx-ws attributes, you must update to use the new extension modules. :contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}

key_changes.change: The deprecated attributes hx-sse and hx-ws have been removed in favour of extension-based implementations.
key_changes.impact: Code relying on those attributes must be updated to the new extension syntax. :contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}

key_changes.change: DELETE requests now use URL parameters instead of form-encoded bodies to align with spec.
key_changes.impact: If you used hx-delete with a request body, you may need to update to query-param style. :contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}

key_changes.change: Support for Internet Explorer is dropped in 2.x.
key_changes.impact: If you still support IE, stay on 1.x or provide fallback. :contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}

key_changes.change: HTMX provides multiple module formats (ESM, AMD, CJS) in /dist. The browser-loadable htmx.js remains.
key_changes.impact: Offers better bundler and module support. :contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5}

key_changes.change: Improved support for Shadow DOM and Web Components in 2.x.
key_changes.impact: If you use custom elements or web components, this version works better. :contentReference[oaicite:6]{index=6}

migration_notes: Ensure you update extension URLs when moving to 2.x (extensions.htmx.org).
Search your code for hx-sse, hx-ws and replace with installation of proper extension modules.
Review hx-delete usage to confirm no request body is used where spec now expects query parameters.
Check browser support requirements (IE-11 and older no longer supported).
Test your HTMX triggers, swap behaviours and custom extensions after upgrade.
focus_for_learning: hx-get, hx-post, hx-put, hx-patch, hx-delete – core request methods
hx-target, hx-swap, hx-trigger – how you control insertion and event timing
hx-ext – how you load and enable extensions (json-enc, ws, sse etc.)
Out-of-band swap (hx-swap-oob) and response headers (HX-Redirect, HX-Trigger)
htmx events (htmx:beforeRequest, htmx:afterSwap etc.) for custom logic
